intro: Scrophularia confusa, commonly known as the common figwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate to lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are usually pink to purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Scrophularia confusa is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many species with similar floral structures and ecological roles.
